summary.long: 2 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
To the church of God that is in Corinth, together with all the saints throughout Achaia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who consoles us in all our affliction, so that we may be able to console those who are in any affliction with the consolation with which we ourselves are consoled by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the sufferings of Christ are abundant for us, so also our consolation is abundant through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are being afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation; if we are being consoled, it is for your consolation, which you experience when you patiently endure the same sufferings that we are also suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our hope for you is unshaken, for we know that as you share in our sufferings, so also you share in our consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not want you to be ignorant, brothers and sisters, of the affliction we experienced in Asia, for we were so utterly, unbearably crushed that we despaired of life itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, we felt that we had received the sentence of death so that we would rely not on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who rescued us from so deadly a peril will continue to rescue us; on him we have set our hope that he will rescue us again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you also join in helping us by your prayers, so that many may give thanks on our behalf for the blessing granted us through the prayers of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, this is our boast, the testimony of our conscience: we have behaved in the world with holiness and godly sincerity, not by earthly wisdom but by the grace of God—and all the more toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we write you nothing other than what you can read and also understand; I hope you will understand until the end—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you have already understood us in part—that on the day of the Lord Jesus we are your boast even as you are our boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since I was sure of this, I wanted to come to you first, so that you might have a double favor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wanted to visit you on my way to Macedonia and to come back to you from Macedonia and have you send me on to Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was I vacillating when I wanted to do this? Do I make my plans according to ordinary human standards, ready to say “Yes, yes” and “No, no” at the same time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As surely as God is faithful, our word to you is not “Yes and No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, whom we proclaimed among you, Silvanus and Timothy and I, was not “Yes and No,” but in him it has always been “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him every one of God’s promises is a “Yes.” For this reason it is through him that we say the “Amen,” to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is God who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has put his seal on us and given us his Spirit in our hearts as a down payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I call on God as witness against me: it was to spare you that I did not come again to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not mean to imply that we lord it over your faith; rather, we are workers with you for your joy because you stand firm in faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I made up my mind not to make another visit that causes you grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I cause you grief, who is there to make me glad but the one whom I have grieved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I wrote as I did, so that when I came, I might not suffer grief from those who should have made me rejoice, for I am confident about all of you, that my joy would be the joy of all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I wrote you out of much distress and anguish of heart and with many tears, not to cause you grief but to let you know the abundant love that I have for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone has caused grief, he has caused it not to me but to some extent—not to exaggerate it—to all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This punishment by the majority is enough for such a person;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so now instead you should forgive and console him, so that he may not be overwhelmed by even worse grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I urge you to reaffirm your love for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote for this reason: to test you and to know whether you are obedient in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone whom you forgive, I also forgive. In fact, what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, has been for your sake in the presence of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we do this so that we may not be outwitted by Satan, for we are not ignorant of his designs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I came to Troas to proclaim the good news of Christ, a door was opened for me in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but my mind could not rest because I did not find my brother Titus there. So I said farewell to them and went on to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who in Christ always leads us in triumphal procession and through us spreads in every place the fragrance that comes from knowing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are the aroma of Christ to God among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the one group a fragrance from death to death, to the other a fragrance from life to life. Who is qualified for these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not peddlers of God’s word like so many, but as persons of sincerity, as persons sent from God, we are speaking in Christ before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Surely we do not need, as some do, letters of recommendation to you or from you, do we?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you show that you are a letter of Christ, prepared by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets that are human hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the confidence that we have through Christ toward God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we are qualified of ourselves to claim anything as coming from us; our qualification is from God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has made us qualified to be ministers of a new covenant, not of letter but of spirit, for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the ministry of death, chiseled in letters on stone tablets, came in glory so that the people of Israel could not gaze at Moses’s face because of the glory of his face, a glory now set aside,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how much more will the ministry of the Spirit come in glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if there was glory in the ministry of condemnation, much more does the ministry of justification abound in glory!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, what once had glory has in this respect lost its glory because of the greater glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for if what was set aside came through glory, much more has the permanent come in glory!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since, then, we have such a hope, we act with complete frankness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not like Moses, who put a veil over his face to keep the people of Israel from gazing at the end of the glory that was being set aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their minds were hardened. Indeed, to this very day, when they hear the reading of the old covenant, the same veil is still there; it is not unveiled since in Christ it is set aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, to this very day whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their minds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when one turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all of us, with unveiled faces, seeing the glory of the Lord as though reflected in a mirror, are being transformed into the same image from one degree of glory to another, for this comes from the Lord, the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since it is by God’s mercy that we are engaged in this ministry, we do not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have renounced the shameful, underhanded ways; we refuse to practice cunning or to falsify God’s word, but by the open statement of the truth we commend ourselves to the conscience of everyone in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their case the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelievers, to keep them from seeing clearly the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not proclaim ourselves; we proclaim Jesus Christ as Lord and ourselves as your slaves for Jesus’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is the God who said, “Light will shine out of darkness,” who has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have this treasure in clay jars, so that it may be made clear that this extraordinary power belongs to God and does not come from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are afflicted in every way but not crushed, perplexed but not driven to despair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecuted but not forsaken, struck down but not destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always carrying around in the body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be made visible in our bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we who are living are always being handed over to death for Jesus’s sake, so that the life of Jesus may also be made visible in our mortal flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So death is at work in us but life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But just as we have the same spirit of faith that is in accordance with scripture—“I believed, and so I spoke”—we also believe, and therefore we also speak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we know that the one who raised Jesus will also raise us with Jesus and will present us with you in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, everything is for your sake, so that grace, when it has extended to more and more people, may increase thanksgiving, to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we do not lose heart. Even though our outer nature is wasting away, our inner nature is being renewed day by day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our slight, momentary affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory beyond all measure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we look not at what can be seen but at what cannot be seen, for what can be seen is temporary, but what cannot be seen is eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know that, if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this tent we groan, longing to be further clothed with our heavenly dwelling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for surely when we have been clothed in it we will not be found naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while we are in this tent, we groan under our burden because we wish not to be unclothed but to be further clothed, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who has given us the Spirit as a down payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we are always confident, even though we know that while we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we walk by faith, not by sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, we do have confidence, and we would rather be away from the body and at home with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whether we are at home or away, we make it our aim to be pleasing to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all of us must appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each may receive due recompense for actions done in the body, whether good or evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord, we try to persuade people, but we ourselves are well known to God, and I hope that we are also well known to your consciences.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are not commending ourselves to you again but giving you an opportunity to boast about us, so that you may be able to answer those who boast in outward appearance and not in the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we are beside ourselves, it is for God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the love of Christ urges us on, because we are convinced that one has died for all; therefore all have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he died for all, so that those who live might live no longer for themselves but for the one who for their sake died and was raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, therefore, we regard no one from a human point of view; even though we once knew Christ from a human point of view, we no longer know him in that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; look, new things have come into being!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and has given us the ministry of reconciliation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, in Christ God was reconciling the world to himself, not counting their trespasses against them, and entrusting the message of reconciliation to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we are ambassadors for Christ, since God is making his appeal through us; we entreat you on behalf of Christ: be reconciled to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our sake God made the one who knew no sin to be sin, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we work together with him, we entreat you also not to accept the grace of God in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he says,
“At an acceptable time I have listened to you,
    and on a day of salvation I have helped you.”
Look, now is the acceptable time; look, now is the day of salvation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are putting no obstacle in anyone’s way, so that no fault may be found with our ministry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as servants of God we have commended ourselves in every way: in great endurance, afflictions, hardships, calamities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beatings, imprisonments, riots, labors, sleepless nights, hunger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in purity, knowledge, patience, kindness, holiness of spirit, genuine love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: truthful speech, and the power of God; with the weapons of righteousness for the right hand and for the left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in honor and dishonor, in ill repute and good repute. We are treated as impostors and yet are true,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as unknown and yet are well known, as dying and look—we are alive, as punished and yet not killed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as sorrowful yet always rejoicing, as poor yet making many rich, as having nothing and yet possessing everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have spoken frankly to you Corinthians; our heart is wide open to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no restriction in our affections but only in yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In return—I speak as to children—open wide your hearts also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be mismatched with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and lawlessness have in common? Or what partnership is there between light and darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What agreement does Christ have with Beliar? Or what does a believer share with an unbeliever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What agreement has the temple of God with idols? For we are the temple of the living God, as God said,
“I will live in them and walk among them,
    and I will be their God,
    and they shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore come out from them,
    and be separate from them, says the Lord,
and touch nothing unclean;
    then I will welcome you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and I will be your father,
    and you shall be my sons and daughters,
says the Lord Almighty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from every defilement of flesh and of spirit, making holiness perfect in the fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make room in your hearts for us; we have wronged no one; we have corrupted no one; we have taken advantage of no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not say this to condemn you, for I have already said that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am being completely frank with you; I have great pride in you; I am filled with consolation; I am overjoyed in all our affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we came into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were afflicted in every way—disputes without and fears within.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God, who consoles the downcast, consoled us by the arrival of Titus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only by his arrival but also by the consolation with which he was consoled about you, as he told us of your longing, your mourning, your zeal for me, so that I rejoiced still more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For although I grieved you with my letter, I do not regret it. Although I did regret it (for I see that that letter caused you grief, though only briefly),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now I rejoice, not because you were grieved but because your grief led to repentance, for you felt a godly grief, so that you were not harmed in any way by us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For godly grief produces a repentance that leads to salvation and brings no regret, but worldly grief produces death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For see what earnestness this godly grief has produced in you, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what zeal, what punishment! At every point you have proved yourselves guiltless in the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So although I wrote to you, it was not on account of the one who did the wrong nor on account of the one who suffered the wrong but in order that your zeal for us might be made known to you before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In this we have found consolation.
In addition to our own consolation, we rejoiced still more at the joy of Titus, because his mind has been set at rest by all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I have been somewhat boastful about you to him, I was not put to shame, but just as everything we said to you was true, so our boasting to Titus has proved true as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his heart goes out all the more to you, as he remembers the obedience of all of you and how you welcomed him with fear and trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoice because I have complete confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We want you to know, brothers and sisters, about the grace of God that has been granted to the churches of Macedonia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for during a severe ordeal of affliction their abundant joy and their extreme poverty have overflowed in a wealth of generosity on their part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, as I can testify, they voluntarily gave according to their means and even beyond their means,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: begging us earnestly for the favor of partnering in this ministry to the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not as we expected. Instead, they gave themselves first to the Lord and, by the will of God, to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we might urge Titus that, as he had already made a beginning, so he should also complete this generous undertaking among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as you excel in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in utmost eagerness, and in our love for you—so we want you to excel also in this generous undertaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not say this as a command, but I am, by mentioning the eagerness of others, testing the genuineness of your love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know the generous act of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, so that by his poverty you might become rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this matter I am giving my opinion: it is beneficial for you who began last year not only to do something but even to desire to do something.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now finish doing it, so that your eagerness may be matched by completing it according to your means.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the eagerness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what one does not have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not mean that there should be relief for others and hardship for you, but it is a question of equality between
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your present abundance and their need, so that their abundance may also supply your need, in order that there may be equality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written,
“The one who had much did not have too much,
    and the one who had little did not have too little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who put in the heart of Titus the same eagerness for you that I myself have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he not only accepted our appeal, but since he is more eager than ever, he is going to you of his own accord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him we are sending the brother who is praised among all the churches for his work for the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only that, but he has also been appointed by the churches to travel with us while we are administering this generous undertaking for the glory of the Lord himself and to show our goodwill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are making this arrangement lest anyone blame us about this generous gift that we are administering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we are setting our minds on what is right not only before the Lord but also before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them we are sending our brother whom we have often tested and found eager in many matters but who is now more eager than ever because of his great confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Titus, he is my partner and coworker in your service; as for our brothers, they are messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore openly before the churches, show them the proof of your love and of our reason for boasting about you to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is not necessary for me to write you about the ministry to the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I know your eagerness, which is the subject of my boasting about you to the people of Macedonia, saying that Achaia has been ready since last year, and your zeal has stirred up most of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am sending the brothers in order that our boasting about you may not prove to have been empty in this case, so that you may be ready, as I said you would be;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: otherwise, if some Macedonians come with me and find that you are not ready, we would be put to shame—to say nothing of you—in this undertaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I thought it necessary to urge the brothers to go on ahead to you and arrange in advance for this bountiful gift that you have promised, so that it may be ready as a bountiful gift and not as an extortion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The point is this: the one who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the one who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you must give as you have made up your mind, not regretfully or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God is able to provide you with every blessing in abundance, so that by always having enough of everything, you may share abundantly in every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed for sowing and increase the harvest of your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be enriched in every way for your great generosity, which will produce thanksgiving to God through us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the rendering of this ministry not only supplies the needs of the saints but also overflows with many thanksgivings to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through the testing of this ministry you glorify God by your obedience to the confession of the gospel of Christ and by the generosity of your partnership with them and with all others,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they long for you and pray for you because of the surpassing grace of God that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself, Paul, appeal to you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—I who am humble when face to face with you but bold toward you when I am away!—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I ask that when I am present I need not show boldness by daring to oppose those who think we are acting according to human standards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, we live as humans but do not wage war according to human standards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the weapons of our warfare are not merely human, but they have divine power to destroy strongholds. We destroy arguments
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every proud obstacle raised up against the knowledge of God, and we take every thought captive to obey Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are ready to punish every disobedience when your obedience is complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at what is before your eyes. If you are confident that you belong to Christ, remind yourself of this, that just as you belong to Christ, so also do we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, even if I boast a little too much of our authority, which the Lord gave for building you up and not for tearing you down, I will not be ashamed of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not want to seem as though I am trying to frighten you with my letters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For someone says, “His letters are weighty and strong, but his bodily presence is weak and his speech contemptible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let such a person understand that what we say by letter when absent we will also do when present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves. But when they measure themselves by one another and compare themselves with one another, they do not show good sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We, however, will not boast beyond limits but will keep within the field that God has assigned to us, to reach out even as far as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we were not overstepping our limits when we reached you; we were the first to come all the way to you with the good news of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not boast beyond limits, that is, in the labors of others, but our hope is that, as your faith increases, our field among you may be greatly enlarged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we may proclaim the good news in lands beyond you, without boasting of work already done in someone else’s field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is not those who commend themselves that are approved but those whom the Lord commends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish you would put up with me in a little foolishness. Yes, do put up with me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I feel a divine jealousy for you, for I promised you in marriage to one husband, to present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am afraid that, as the serpent deceived Eve by its cunning, your thoughts will be led astray from a sincere and pure devotion to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone comes and proclaims another Jesus than the one we proclaimed, or if you receive a different spirit from the one you received, or a different gospel from the one you accepted, you put up with it readily enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I think that I am not in the least inferior to these super-apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I am untrained in speech, I certainly am not with respect to knowledge; certainly in every way and in all things we have made this evident to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I commit a sin by humbling myself so that you might be exalted, because I proclaimed God’s good news to you free of charge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I robbed other churches by accepting support from them in order to serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I was with you and was in need, I did not burden anyone, for my needs were supplied by the brothers who came from Macedonia. So I refrained and will continue to refrain from burdening you in any way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the truth of Christ is in me, this boast of mine will not be silenced in the regions of Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what I do I will also continue to do, in order to deny an opportunity to those who want an opportunity to be recognized as our equals in what they boast about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For such boasters are false apostles, deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no wonder! Even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is not strange if his ministers also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness. Their end will match their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I repeat, let no one think that I am a fool, but if you do, then accept me as a fool, so that I, too, may boast a little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am saying in regard to this boastful undertaking, I am saying not with the Lord’s authority but as a fool;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since many boast according to human standards, I will also boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you gladly put up with fools, being wise yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you put up with it when someone makes slaves of you or preys upon you or takes advantage of you or puts on airs or gives you a slap in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To my shame, I must say, we were too weak for that!
But whatever anyone dares to boast of—I am speaking as a fool—I also dare to boast of that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they ministers of Christ? I am talking like a madman—I am a better one: with far greater labors, far more imprisonments, with countless floggings, and often near death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five times I have received from the Jews the forty lashes minus one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I received a stoning. Three times I was shipwrecked; for a night and a day I was adrift at sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on frequent journeys, in danger from rivers, danger from bandits, danger from my own people, danger from gentiles, danger in the city, danger in the wilderness, danger at sea, danger from false brothers and sisters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in toil and hardship, through many a sleepless night, hungry and thirsty, often without food, cold and naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, besides other things, I am under daily pressure because of my anxiety for all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is made to stumble, and I am not indignant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus (blessed be he forever!) knows that I do not lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Damascus, the governor under King Aretas guarded the city of Damascus in order to seize me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall and escaped from his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is necessary to boast; nothing is to be gained by it, but I will go on to visions and revelations of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know a person in Christ who fourteen years ago was caught up to the third heaven—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know; God knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that such a person—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know; God knows—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was caught up into paradise and heard things that are not to be told, that no mortal is permitted to repeat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On behalf of such a one I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except of my weaknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I wish to boast, I will not be a fool, for I will be speaking the truth. But I refrain from it, so that no one may think better of me than what is seen in me or heard from me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even considering the exceptional character of the revelations. Therefore, to keep me from being too elated, a thorn was given me in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to torment me, to keep me from being too elated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I appealed to the Lord about this, that it would leave me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for power is made perfect in weakness.” So I will boast all the more gladly of my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may dwell in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I am content with weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and calamities for the sake of Christ, for whenever I am weak, then I am strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been a fool! You forced me to it. Indeed you should have been the ones commending me, for I am not at all inferior to these super-apostles, even though I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The signs of an apostle were performed among you with utmost patience, signs and wonders and mighty works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How have you been worse off than the other churches, except that I myself did not burden you? Forgive me this wrong!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here I am, ready to come to you this third time, and I will not be a burden because I do not want what is yours but you, for children ought not to save up for their parents but parents for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will most gladly spend and be spent for you. If I love you more, am I to be loved less?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be that as it may, I did not burden you. But, crafty person that I am, did I take you in by deceit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I take advantage of you through any of those whom I sent to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I urged Titus to go and sent the brother with him. Titus did not take advantage of you, did he? Did we not conduct ourselves with the same spirit? Did we not walk in the same footsteps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you been thinking all along that we have been defending ourselves before you? We are speaking in Christ before God. Everything we do, beloved, is for the sake of building you up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I fear that when I come I may find you not as I wish and that you may find me not as you wish; I fear that there may perhaps be quarreling, jealousy, anger, selfishness, slander, gossip, conceit, and disorder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fear that when I come again my God may humble me before you and that I may have to mourn over many who previously sinned and have not repented of the impurity, sexual immorality, and debauchery that they have practiced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the third time I am coming to you. “Any charge must be sustained by the evidence of two or three witnesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I warned those who sinned previously and all the others, and I warn them now while absent, as I did when present on my second visit, that if I come again I will not be lenient—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you desire proof that Christ is speaking in me. He is not weak in dealing with you but is powerful in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was crucified in weakness but lives by the power of God. For we are weak in him, but in dealing with you we will live with him by the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Examine yourselves to see whether you are living in the faith. Test yourselves. Do you not realize that Jesus Christ is in you?—unless, indeed, you fail to meet the test!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope you will find out that we have not failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we pray to God that you may not do anything wrong—not that we may appear to have met the test but that you may do what is right, though we may seem to have failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot do anything against the truth but only for the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we rejoice when we are weak but you are strong. This is what we pray for, that you may be restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I write these things while I am away from you, so that when I come I may not have to be severe in using the authority that the Lord has given me for building up and not for tearing down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers and sisters, farewell. Be restored; listen to my appeal; agree with one another; live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the saints greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
